monogr.title: Tvvo histories of Ireland : The one written by Edmund Campion, the other by Meredith Hanmer Dr of Divinity
monogr.author: Campion, Edmund, saint

div.head:
To the most renowned & valiant Lord,Lord Deputy of Ireland.
Arthur Lord Grey of VVilton, Knight of the noble order of the Garter &c.
div.l: MOst noble Lord, the pillor of my life,
And Patron of my Muses pupillage,
Through whose large bountie poured on me rife,
In the first season of my feeble age,
I now doe live, bound yours by vassalage,
Sith nothing ever may redeeme, or reave
Out of your endlesse debt so sure a gage,
Vouchsafe in worth this small gift to receive,
Which in your noble hands for pledge I leave
Of all the rest, that I am tyde t'account:
Rude rimes, the which a rustick Muse did weave
In savage soyle, far from Parnasso mount,
And roughly wrought in an unlearned Loome:
The which vouchsafe deare Lord, your favourable doome.
